Description: Lower body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black (fired reddish); faded added white band above part of a lotus bud in white outline with traces of added red centre; exterior: from top, part of brown band; near bottom of sherd, three brown bands; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The sherd probably belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1924,1201.466.a, 1924,1201.466.b and 1924,1201.517 (the obverse of the vessel has a guilloche pattern instead of a maeander pattern).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0474) (phase 2)
